div.l: The Reues Prologe
Whan folk hade laughen at this nyce caas
Of absolon and hend Nycholas
Dyuerse folk dyuersly thei seyd
But for the more part loughe and pleyd
Ne at this tale I saugh no man̄ hym greue
But hit were onely Oswold the Refe
By caus he was of the Carpenter crafte
A litell Ire in his herte lafte
He gan to grucche ⁊and blamede hit a lite
So theke qᵈuod he full wele coude I ȝow quyte
With bleryng of a proude myller eye
Yf that me lyst to speke of rybaldrye
But ike am olde me lyst not pley for age
Grase tyme is done my fodder is forage
This white toppe wryteth myn olde ȝeres
Myn herte also is movled as my heres
But yf I fare as dothe an opyn ers
That ilke fruyt is euer lenger the wers
Till hit be roten in mullok or in stree
We olde men̄ I drede so faire we
Till we be roten kan we noght be rype
We hopen alwey while the worlde will pipe
For in oure will ther styketh euere a nayle
To haue an hoore hede ⁊and a grene taile
As haith a leke for þough oure myght be gone
Oure wille desireth eủer still in oone
For whan we may noȝt done than will we speke
Ȝet in oure asshen olde is fire yreke
Foure gledes han we whiche I shall deuyse
Auauntyng lying anger couetyse
This foure sperketh longth vn to elde
Oure olde lymes may wele ben̄ vn welde
But wille ne shall not fayle that is sothe
